title: Man Kicked Out Of Joker Screening For Spitting At People & Cheering Loudly When Characters Died
text:
The movie is unsettling, the critics had warned even before it released. Joaquin Phoenix starrer Joker has left people terrified across the globe. So much so, that people are walking out of the theatres and asking for the movie to be banned.

Twitter

A lot of people have been tweeting their discontentment with the content of Joker. According to them, the Tod Phillips directorial glorifies violence and encourages people to sympathise with a villainous character.

I’m watching Joker with my brother and sister in law but I needed to find an excuse to walk out for a second cuz this movie has made me the most uncomfortable I’ve ever been at a theater in years — 🦇 #1 susie fan 🦇 (@masterbunne) October 4, 2019

Amid all this, a man was found spitting at the patrons and cheering loudly during a screening of the movie at Times Square. Soon, he was kicked out of the theatre.

“This is the guy who spent our entire screening of JOKER in NYC spitting at people and clapping whenever Joker killed somebody. Security escorted him out after a third of the audience fled the theater out of fear that he’d start hurting people,” tweeted a witness at the AMC Empire 25 theatre.

“This is the guy who calmly confronted the guy and deescalated the situation until security came. Coming out everybody was shaking his hand and calling him a hero. I asked for his name and he said “V for Vegas.” Not all heroes wear capes, folks,” he wrote in another tweet.

According to another witness, the man had been drinking before the screening of Joker. “I was there. Dude sat next to me. I saw him pour a full bottle of tequila into his slushee b4 the movie started. When he stumbled away wasted, I thought he had left. But I guess he just sat somewhere else and started his clapping. Shit was scary - like a 4-D movie experience,” he wrote.

But I guess he just sat somewhere else and started his clapping. Shit was scary - like a 4-D movie experience. 😬 — Etai Benson (@etaibenson) October 5, 2019

Meanwhile, high security has been places in most the theatres in the US as it is being feared that Joker’s depiction of the Batman character might lead to mass shootings. Some people are fearing that Joker could inspire another incident like 2012 Aurora, Colorado theatre shooting, where a gunman called James Holmes killed 12 people at the opening weekend of The Dark Night Rises, a Batman film. He had identified himself as the Joker when he was arrested. He is currently serving 12 life sentences.

With that, the use of Masks and face paints has also been banned at the theatres.
description: A man was found spitting at the patrons and cheering loudly during a screening of Joker near Times Square. Soon, he was kicked out of the theatre. According to another witness, the man had been drinking before the screening of Joker. Meanwhile, high security has been places in most the theatres in the US.
